item.title: iVirus
item.description: The iVirus project is a collaboration between the Hurwitz lab, of the University of Arizona, and the Sullivan lab, of the Ohio State University. It arose from noticing the painfully obvious need to make viral ecology tools open and available to the viral ecology community. With the recent (well, for the past decade or so) rise in next-generation sequencing, the field of viral ecology has dramatically expanded our knowledge of the “virosphere”, led in no small part by the dramatically lower cost to sequence environmental viruses.
